setting.name: Channel
setting.description: Set/read the RF channel (Uses IEEE 802.15.4 channel numbering).

setting.name: Network PAN ID
setting.description: The network PAN (Personal Area Network) ID. Only modules with a matching ID can communicate with each other. Set ID = 0xFFFF to send message to all PANs.

setting.name: Compatibility Options
setting.description: Set/read compatibility options. These bits should only be set when communicating with XBee S1 modules. Bitfield map: Bit 0 - Transmit like legacy 802.15.4 at the cost of reduced throughput Bit 1 - Perform legacy 802.15.4 node discovery which locks out other AT commands for a longer period of time

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: A human-friendly node identifier string for this module. This can be up to 20 ASCII characters. This value is returned in a ND query and can be used to easily identify modules.

setting.name: Node Discover Time
setting.description: The network discovery back-off parameter. This sets the maximum value for the random delay used for network discovery responses to be sent (Used by ND and DN commands).

setting.name: Node Discover Options
setting.description: Bitfield of network discovery options for this module Options include: Bit 0 - Append DD value to end of network discovery

setting.name: MAC Mode
setting.description: Configure the MAC Mode of the device. This enables/disables a Digi-proprietary header in the 802.15.4 RF packet and whether or not MAC ACKs should be used. Enabling the Digi header (MM = 0 or 3) allows duplicate packet detection and network discovery via ND and DN commands. Options 1 and 2 are strict 802.15.4 modes which are compatible with some third-party 802.15.4 devices.

setting.name: Maximum Packet Payload Length
setting.description: The maximum number of payload bytes that can be sent in a RF transmission Depends on Digi Header (MM), Encryption (EE), Source and Destination settings (MY, DH, DL).

setting.name: Device Role
setting.description: Configure the role of the current device. When configured as a coordinator, SP determines the indirect messaging timeout value. Options include: 0 - End Device, use A1 to configure end device association options 1 - Coordinator, use A2 to configure coordinator options

setting.name: End Device Association
setting.description: Set/read End Device association options. CE must be set to 0 in order to act as an end device. Bitfield map: Bit 0 - Allow PanId reassignment Bit 1 - Allow Channel reassignment (using SC mask rather than CH) Bit 2 - Auto Associate with PAN Coordinator Bit 3 - Poll indirect messaging coordinator on pin wake

setting.name: Coordinator Association
setting.description: Set/read Coordinator association options. CE must be set to 1 in order to act as a coordinator. Bitfield map: Bit 0 - Allow PanId reassignment Bit 1 - Allow Channel reassignment (using SC mask rather than CH) Bit 2 - Become PAN Coordinator and allow Association

setting.name: Scan Channels
setting.description: Defines the list of channels used during an Active Scan or Energy Detect as a bitfield. Scans are initiated by the AS or ED commands and during End Device Association and Coordinator startup. Each bit in the mask corresponds to an IEEE 802.15.4 channel: Bit 0 - Channel 11 (0x0B) Bit 2 - Channel 12 (0x0C) ... Bit 15 - Channel 26 (0x1A)

setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: Read Association status code: 0x00 - End Device is associated, coordinator started, or device is configured for peer-to-peer 0x03 - End Device found a coordinator, but it does not allow association 0x05 - End Device found a coordinator, but the PAN ID does not match (A1 bit 0 allows reassignment) 0x06 - End Device found a coordinator, but the channel does not match (A1 bit 1 allows reassignment) 0x0C - End Device failed to get an association request 0x13 - End Device is disassociated 0xFF - Initialization, no status determined yet

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: The lower 32 bits of the unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address assigned to this module

setting.name: 16-bit Source Address
setting.description: The 16-bit source address for the device. Set MY = 0xFFFF to use a 64-bit long source address; the 64-bit source address is the serial number (SH + SL).

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: The upper 32 bits of the 64-bit destination address. Set the DH register to zero and DL less than 0xFFFF to transmit using a 16-bit short address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit destination address. Set the DH register to zero and DL less than 0xFFFF to transmit using a 16-bit short address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN.

setting.name: XBee Retries
setting.description: Set number of retries the modem will execute in addition to the 3 retries provided by the 802.15.4 MAC. For each XBee retry, the 802.15.4 MAC can execute up to 3 retries.

setting.name: Transmit Options
setting.description: The module's transmit options. These options are used for all transmissions (API transmissions can override this using the TxOptions field of the API frame). Bitfield options: Bit 0 - Disable MAC ACKs Bit 2 - Send to broadcast PAN ID All other bits must be set to 0

setting.name: AES Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enables AES encryption

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: Sets key used for encryption and decryption. This parameter is write-only and cannot be read.

setting.name: Disable Functionality
setting.description: Bitfield of features which can be disabled. Options include: Bit 2 - Disable OTA Firmware. When set to 1, the device cannot receive an OTA update. All other option bits should be set to 0.

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: Select transmitter output power.

setting.name: Output power in dBm
setting.description: Read the output power in dBm. Negative values will be represented in two's compliment.

setting.name: Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the Clear Channel Assessment () threshold. If the modem detects energy above the Threshold, if will not transmit. The parameter is measured in units of -dBm. A zero value will disable . The threshold is set upon initialization; if CA is changed, the value must be written to flash using the WR command and the module power cycled (or reset using the FR command) before it can be used.

setting.name: Random Delay Slots
setting.description: Set/Read the minimum value of the back-off exponent in the CSMA-CA algorithm that is used for collision avoidance. If RN = 0, collision avoidance is disabled.

setting.name: Last Packet RSSI
setting.description: Read signal level of last good packet received (RSSI) in -dBm (reports absolute value, eg. -88dBm = 0x58).

setting.name: ACK Failures
setting.description: Reset/read count of acknowledgment failures. This register increments when the modem expires the retries without receiving an ACK on a packet transmission. This count saturates at its maximum value. Set EA to zero to reset count.

setting.name: Failures
setting.description: Reset/read count of Clear Channel Assessment () failures. This register increments when the modem does not transmit a packet because it detected energy above the threshold level set with CA command. This count saturates at its maximum value. Set EC to zero to reset count.

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Set/read sleep mode. Pin sleep requires D8 and/or P7 to be set to 1 to invoke sleep.

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: The sleep time of the module. If the device is a coordinator (CE=1) and SP is not 0, the device will send all transmissions indirectly, meaning end devices will have to poll the coordinator to receive data (ATFP or using cyclic sleep). The coordinator will discard the data after (SP * 2.5) or (65 seconds) whichever is smaller.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: Set/read time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep. The ST parameter is used only with Cyclic Sleep settings (SM=4-5).

setting.name: Disassociated Cyclic Sleep Period
setting.description: The sleep period for cyclic sleeping remotes that are configured for Association (CE = 0, A1 = 4) but that are not associated to a Coordinator. Use the AI command to determine the device's association status.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Advanced sleep options Bitfield map: Bit 0 - Enables/Disables sending a wakeup indirect messaging poll request on devices configured for cyclic sleep Bit 1 - Suppresses sending ADC/DIO samples when waking from cyclic sleep Bits 2-7 - Reserved Bit 8 - Always wake for ST time

setting.name: UART Baud Rate
setting.description: The serial interface baud rate for communication between modem serial port and host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window. Read BD to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: UART Parity
setting.description: Configure parity for the UART.

setting.name: UART Stop Bits
setting.description: Configure the number of stop bits that the UART will output.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: The flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive.

setting.name: Transparent Packetization Timeout
setting.description: Set/read number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins in transparent mode. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: The API mode setting. RF Packets received can be formatted into API frames to be sent out the serial port. When API is enabled the serial data must be formatted as API frames as transparent mode is disabled.

setting.name: API Output Mode
setting.description: The API data frame type output format for received API frames. When AP is set to 2, this will affect how I/O samples are gathered and transmitted.

setting.name: Extended API Options
setting.description: Set the extended API options. This controls whether or not ZCL packets should be routed to the serial port.

category.name: AT Command Options
category.description: Change AT command mode behavior. Command mode is only accessible via the UART.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read character value to be used to break from data mode to command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character.

setting.name: AT Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: Set required period of silence before, after and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

category.name: UART pin configuration
category.description: Pin configuration for the UART interface

setting.name: DIO6/RTS Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6/RTS line of the module. TH pin 16 Options include: RTS flow control Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO7/CTS Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7/CTS line of the module. TH pin 12 Options include: CTS flow control Digital input Digital output RS-485 control

setting.name: DIO13/UART_DOUT Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO13/UART_DOUT line of the module. TH pin 2 Options include: UART DOUT Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO14/UART_DIN Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO14/UART_DIN line of the module. TH pin 3 Options include: UART DIN Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO0/AD0/Commissioning Button Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD0/DIO0/Commissioning line of the module. TH Pin 20 Options include: Commissioning button ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO1/AD1/SPI_nATTN Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD1/DIO1/SPI_nATTN line of the module. TH pin 19 Options include: SPI_nATTN on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO2/AD2/SPI_CLK Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD2/DIO2/SPI_CLK line of the module. TH pin 18 Options include: SPI_CLK on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO3/AD3/SPI_nSSEL Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module. TH pin 17 Options include: SPI_nSSEL on TH variant ADC input Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO4/SPI_MOSI Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO4/SPI_MOSI line of the module. TH pin 11 Options include: SPI_MOSI on TH variant Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO5/Association LED Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO5/Assoc line of the module. TH pin 15 Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO8/DTR/Sleep_Rq Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO8/DTR/Sleep Request line of the module. TH pin 9 Options include: Sleep Request/DTR (used with pin hibernate and pin wake) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO9/Sleep Indicator Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO9/Sleep Indicator line of the module. TH pin 13 Options include: Awake/nSleep indicator (pin is LOW when module is asleep) Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO10/RSSI/PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO10/RSSI/PWM0 line of the module. M0 controls the PWM duty cycle when configured as a PWM output. TH pin 6 Options include: RSSI PWM Output Digital Input and Output

setting.name: DIO11 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO11/PWM1 line of the module. M1 controls the PWM duty cycle when configured as a PWM output. TH pin 7 Options include: PWM output Digital input Digital output

setting.name: DIO12/SPI_MISO Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO12/SPI_MISO line of the module. TH pin 4 Options include: SPI_MISO on TH variant Digital input Digital output

setting.name: Pull-up/down Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pull-up/down resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pull-up/down enabled, 0=no internal pull-up/down. Bitfield map: Bit0 - DIO4 | TH Pin 11 Bit1 - DIO3 | TH Pin 17 Bit2 - DIO2 | TH Pin 18 Bit3 - DIO1 | TH Pin 19 Bit4 - DIO0 | TH Pin 20 Bit5 - DIO6 | TH Pin 16 Bit6 - DIO8 | TH Pin 9 Bit7 - DIO14 | TH Pin 3 Bit8 - DIO5 | TH Pin 15 Bit9 - DIO9 | TH Pin 13 Bit10 - DIO12 | TH Pin 4 Bit11 - DIO10 | TH Pin 6 Bit12 - DIO11 | TH Pin 7 Bit13 - DIO7 | TH Pin 12 Bit14 - DIO13 | TH Pin 2

setting.name: Pull-up/down Direction
setting.description: Set/read resistor direction (1=pull-up, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command. Refer to the PR command for bitfield mask.

setting.name: PWM0 Duty Cycle
setting.description: Set PWM0 Duty cyle. The PWM period is 64 us theres are 0x3FF (1023 decimal) steps within this period. Example M0=0 (0% PWM), 0x1FF (50% PWM), 0x3FF (100% PWM)

setting.name: PWM1 Duty Cycle
setting.description: Set PWM1 Duty cyle. The PWM period is 64 us theres are 0x3FF (1023 decimal) steps within this period. Example M1=0 (0% PWM), 0x1FF (50% PWM), 0x3FF (100% PWM)

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: RSSI PWM timeout register. Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI PWM pin (P0). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet or APS acknowledgment and is shut off when the timer expires.

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: The Associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: IO Sampling Rate
setting.description: Set the I/O sampling rate to enable periodic sampling. If set >0, all enabled digital I/O and analog inputs will be sampled and transmitted every IR milliseconds. I/O Samples are transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

setting.name: Digital I/O Change Detection
setting.description: Bitfield that configures which digital input pins should be monitored for change detection. If a change is detected on an enabled digital input pin, a digital I/O sample is immediately transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL. Bitfield map: Bit0 - DIO0 Bit1 - DIO1 Bit2 - DIO2 Bit3 - DIO3 Bit4 - DIO4 Bit5 - DIO5 Bit6 - DIO6 Bit7 - DIO7 Bit8 - DIO8 Bit9 - DIO9 Bit10 - DIO10 Bit11 - DIO11 Bit12 - DIO12 Bit13 - DIO13 Bit14 - DIO14

setting.name: Analog Voltage Reference
setting.description: The analog voltage reference used for A/D sampling.

setting.name: Samples before TX
setting.description: Set/read number of samples to collect before transmission. This command is only applicable when AO is set to 2. The maximum number of samples is dependent on the size of the I/O sample data and maximum payload size.

setting.name: I/O Input Address
setting.description: The source address of the device to which outputs are bound. To disable I/O line passing, set all bytes to 0xFF. To allow any I/O packet addressed to this device (including broadcasts) to change the outputs, set IA to 0xFFFF.

setting.name: Enable Serial Output For I/O Line Passing
setting.description: When I/O line passing is enabled, optionally suppress serial output if source address matches IA or if IA is set to 0xFFFF. 0=Suppress output, 1=Allow output

setting.name: D0 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D1 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D2 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D3 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D4 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D5 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D6 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D7 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D8 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: D9 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: P0 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: P1 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: P2 Output Timeout
setting.description: Set/Read Output timeout value. When output is set, due to I/O line passing, to a non-default level a timer is started which when expired will set the output to it default level. The timer is reset when a valid I/O packet is received. If set to 0, there is no timeout.

setting.name: PWM Output Timeout
setting.description: Specifies how long both PWM outputs (P0, P1) output a given PWM signal before it reverts to the configured value (M0/M1). If set to 0, there is no timeout. This timeout only affects these pins when they are configured as PWM output.

setting.name: MicroPython Auto Start
setting.description: Configure the module to automatically run compiled MicroPython bytecode stored in flash.

category.name: File System Options
category.description: Configure the device's File System options

setting.name: File System Public Key
setting.description: Configure the device's File System Public Key

setting.name: File System Public Key
setting.description: Configure the device's File System Public Key

setting.name: Bluetooth Enable
setting.description: Configure the module to enable Bluetooth.

setting.name: Bluetooth MAC Address
setting.description: Read the module's EUI-48 Bluetooth MAC address

setting.name: Bluetooth Authentication
setting.description: Configure Bluetooth authentication with a password or an SRP salt/verifier.

category.name: Authentication
category.description: Parameters for authenticating Bluetooth API access

setting.name: SRP Salt
setting.description: 32-bit random value to make attempts to brute force passwords more difficult.

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 1)
setting.description: Most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 2)
setting.description: Second most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 3)
setting.description: Third most significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

setting.name: SRP Verifier (part 4)
setting.description: Least significant 32 bytes of the 128 byte verifier

category.name: Location
category.description: User-defined parameters used to store the physical location of the deployed device.

setting.name: Location X
setting.description: User-defined GPS latitude coordinates of the node that is displayed on Digi Remote Manager and Network Assistant.

setting.name: Location Y
setting.description: User-defined GPS longitude coordinates of the node that is displayed on Digi Remote Manager and Network Assistant.

setting.name: Location Z
setting.description: User-defined GPS elevation of the node that is displayed on Digi Remote Manager and Network Assistant.

category.name: Diagnostics - Firmware/Hardware Information
category.description: Information about the XBee hardware and firmware

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read modem firmware version number.

setting.name: Bootloader Version
setting.description: Display the Bootloader version

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read modem hardware version number.

setting.name: Hardware/Firmware Compatibility
setting.description: Specifies what firmware is compatible with this radio. Firmware with a compatibility value lower than the value returned by %C cannot be loaded onto the board.

setting.name: Supply Voltage
setting.description: Read the supply voltage of the module in mV units.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: Read power compensation temperature sensor in units of Celsius degrees.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: The Digi device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Configuration Checksum
setting.description: The CRC of the current settings. The purpose of this command is to allow the detection of an unexpected configuration change on a device. After a firmware update this command may return a different value.
